SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
SAFETY CLOUD
Health Card QR Code Verification

With SMART Health Cards, individuals can keep copies of their vaccination and lab test result records on hand and share their information with others if they choose. Safety Cloud provides Health Verification from a Health Card QR code.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Available in: Enterprise and Unlimited Editions.

Safety Cloud provides automated verification from a Health Card QR code.

Users can share SMART Health Cards for verification by:

Selecting Health Card QR code from the Health Verification form and uploading an image of the card, in the same way a user uploads an image of their vaccination card.

Presenting the card to the Visualforce barcode scanner page on a verifier’s device, for point-of-entry verification.

Unlike COVID-19 Vaccination Record Cards, SMART Health Cards embed health-related data in a QR code, which can’t be read and analyzed manually by an agent. Instead, Safety Cloud extracts health data from the QR code automatically and analyzes and verifies it programmatically.

This diagram illustrates health verification processing based on how the user submits their SMART Health Card.

When a card holder submits their SMART Health Card for verification by presenting it to the Visualforce Scanner page or by uploading an image of it, Safety Cloud extracts and analyzes the QR code and creates a Health Card record.

The newly created Health Card record is linked to the associated Health Verification record and has a Verification Status = New.

Differentiating Between Vaccination Data and Laboratory Test Data

When Safety Cloud extracts the QR Code from the SMART Health Card, it distinguishes between vaccination data and laboratory report data.

Health Cards containing vaccination data have a fhirBundle. It has one Patient resource, which contains the card holder’s details, and one or more Immunization resources, which contain their vaccine details. In this case, for the payload, Safety Cloud creates a Health Verification record that includes the related Health Card record with the related Dose record.

Health Cards containing Laboratory report data have a fhirBundle. It has one Patient resource, which contains the card holder’s details, and one or more Observation resources, which contain their test reports. In this case, for the payload, Safety Cloud creates a Health Verification record that includes the related Health Card record and related Lab Result record.

For an example of the complete JWS payload data, see fhir-shc-vaccination-ig/examples/Scenario3Bundle-jws-payload-expanded.json.

Point-of-Entry Health Verification
SMART Health Card holders can scan their SMART Health Card for point-of-entry health verification. Safety Cloud provides an out-of-the-box Visualforce barcode scanner page that can be installed on any browser.
Configure the Visualforce Barcode Scanner Page for Point-of-Entry Verification
Safety Cloud comes with a Visualforce page that you can use to scan SMART Health Card QR codes. You can load the Visualforce page on any browser. After it’s scanned, the QR code’s payload is extracted and verified by the Safety Cloud health card verification service.
Enable the Known Issuers Directory
As an admin, you can enable the Known Issuer Directories Setup feature to import an up-to-date list of known SMART Health Card issuers. The data from the Known Issuers directory helps Safety Cloud determine whether the SMART Health Card shared by a card holder is valid and credible.

title: Health Verification with SMART Health Cards
